name: Questing.lua
tagline: A Lua script for PROShine that plays Pokemon Revolution Online for you from the very Start to as far as possible.
body:
### Questing.lua
Questing.lua is a script for [PROShine](https://proshine-bot.ml) that plays Pokemon Revolution Online for you from the very Start to as far as possible.

### How To Use
To use Questing.lua, simply [download the latest version](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/releases), unzip it in your PROShine *Scripts* folder and, optionally, edit the configuration file `config.lua`.
Then open the `Questing.lua` root file from PROShine.

### How Far Does It Go
Each official release comes with a changelog on [the release page](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/releases).

If you cannot wait for the next official release, you can check [the Quests files of each region](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/tree/master/Quests), alternatively you can check the [QuestManager.lua](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/blob/master/Quests/QuestManager.lua) where all the quests are loaded and sorted.

### Contribute
You can create your own quests. A [template quest file](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/blob/master/Quests/TemplateQuest.lua) is updated frequently to help you.

If you have a good knowledge of Lua you can improve the structure of the code and create pull requests. However I would advise creating a ticket on the [issue tracker](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/issues) to discuss new ideas.

Questing.lua could also use some other advanced scripts to manage the fights, the team setup or a global path finding script. If you want to work on such complicated and heavy scripts, do not hesitate to contact me, preferably via the [issue tracker](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/issues).

### Authors and Contributors
Created by g0ld (@g0ldPRO), Questing.lua is under the *Do What The Fuck You Want To* pubic license.  
With the help of @Rympex.

### Support or Contact
If you encounter any bug, please use the [issue tracker](https://github.com/g0ldPRO/Questing.lua/issues) with as many details as possible to reproduce the bug.

Note that the bug report section of the PROShine forum concerns only the PROShine software, not this script.

You can get assistance in the [PROShine forum](https://proshine-bot.ml/viewforum.php?id=4).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
